Diagnosis

The build failed at the stage of installing dependencies with the following error:

Failed during stage 'Install dependencies': dependency_installation script returned non-zero exit code: 1

The error in the log points to an issue in the Bundler gem related to the version mismatch, indicated by the stack trace starting at line 22 in the file shared_helpers.rb.

Solution

  1. Update Bundler Version: Update the Bundler Gem version in your project to a version that is compatible with the Ruby version being used. You can specify the Bundler version in your Gemfile.

  2. Lock Down Ruby Version: Ensure that the Ruby version used in your project matches the one expected by Bundler to avoid version conflicts.

  3. Verify Gemfile: Make sure your Gemfile specifies the correct versions of gems and dependencies required for the project.

  4. Clear Cache: Sometimes, clearing the cache and dependencies cache can resolve such issues. You can try clearing the cache and rebuilding.

If after taking these steps the issue persists, consider changing Node versions as a last resort.

A fully automated content pipeline that tracks latest trends in Data Engineering, Machine Learning, and AI development, and instantly generates ready-to-post content for LinkedIn, X (Twitter), and YouTube (long & short formats).

üîπ Step 1: Trend Discovery (Input)

  • Source: Perplexity API (live web search with AI summarization).
  • Output: JSON with {title, summary, source, why_it_matters} for top 5 daily trends.
  • ‚úÖ Ensures content is always fresh, relevant, and credible.

üîπ Step 2: Content Generation (Processing)

  • Engine: GPT-5 (or GPT-5 Thinking for deeper reasoning if needed).
  • Input: Each trend JSON.

  • Output:

    • LinkedIn Post ‚Äì 220‚Äì280 words, professional, insightful.
    • X Post ‚Äì 1 tweet + 1 mini-thread (punchy + shareable).
    • YouTube Long Script ‚Äì 5‚Äì7 mins, detailed, with visuals.
    • YouTube Short Script ‚Äì 45‚Äì60 sec, high-energy, hook-driven.

üîπ Step 3: Packaging (Output)

  • Content is automatically saved into Markdown files.
  • Each file includes all 4 content formats for a trend.
  • Example: 2025-09-09_Spark_Faster_LLMs.md
  • ‚úÖ Easy to copy-paste into LinkedIn/X/YouTube.

üîπ Step 4: Scaling & Automation

  • Daily cron job / GitHub Actions to run the script.
  • Output organized into date-based folders (/2025-09-09/).
  • Optional: Auto-publish via LinkedIn API / X API / YouTube API ‚Üí zero manual effort.
  • Future: Add image generation (DALL¬∑E / MidJourney API) for thumbnails & LinkedIn banners.

üåç The Big Value

  • You become a consistent thought leader in DE/ML/AI.
  • Saves hours of research + writing daily.
  • Scales across multiple platforms instantly.
  • Maintains privacy & control (all runs locally or in your infra).
  • Every piece is validated + high-quality, not generic fluff.

üëâ In short: We‚Äôre building a personal content studio powered by AI ‚Üí it listens to the internet, summarizes what matters, and turns it into multi-platform posts/scripts in your voice.

Want to start building the MVP right now? üöÄ?

üéØ MVP = Minimum Viable Product

Simple Definition: The smallest, simplest version of your idea that actually works and proves the concept.

For Your Content Engine:

‚ùå NOT MVP (Too Complex):

  • Full automation with cron jobs
  • API integrations for auto-posting
  • Image generation
  • Multiple platforms at once

‚úÖ MVP (Simple & Testable):

  • 1 script that you run manually
  • Gets 5 trends from Perplexity API
  • Generates LinkedIn posts for those trends
  • Saves to simple text files
  • Takes 30 minutes to build

üöÄ ‚ÄúWant to start building right now?‚Äù

I mean: Let‚Äôs actually code this MVP together in the next 30 minutes:

  1. I write the Python script for you
  2. You test it with your API keys
  3. We see real results (actual LinkedIn posts generated)
  4. Prove the concept works before building the full system

Benefits of Starting Now:

  • See if the idea actually works (validation)
  • Get real content you can use immediately
  • Learn what needs improvement before investing weeks
  • Have something working in 30 minutes vs. 2 weeks

Think of MVP as: ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs build the simplest version that proves this idea is gold, then make it fancy later.‚Äù

No! The command I used clones into the developer folder, not inside your current repo:

üìÅ Directory Structure:

Current:

/Users/niranjan/developer/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ niranjanagaram.github.io/  ‚Üê Your website repo (where we are now)

After cloning:

/Users/niranjan/developer/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ niranjanagaram.github.io/  ‚Üê Your website repo
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ ai-customer-support-system/  ‚Üê New AI project repo

The cwd parameter in my command is /Users/niranjan/developer (parent folder), so it clones alongside your website repo, not inside it.

This gives you:

  • ‚úÖ Two separate repos in the same developer folder
  • ‚úÖ Easy to switch between projects in VS Code
  • ‚úÖ Keep this chat thread open while working on both
  • ‚úÖ Clean separation of website vs. AI project
